snippet: The move by Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is supported by the United States as a means to help offset China’s growing military might.
abstract: Government of Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe discards 1960s ban on export of weapons and military hardware, taking country further away from postwar pacifism; move, which is supported by United States, is aimed at helping Japan assume larger regional security role to offset China's growing military might.
lead_paragraph: The move by Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is supported by the United States as a means to help offset China’s growing military might.

headline.main: Japan Ends Decades-Long Ban on Export of Weapons
headline.print_headline: After Decades, Japan Ends Ban on Export of Weapons
